data.text: @tony_burnetti @Lan_Alexander_ @kjoules I can not find any baseline on all cause death for HK for February 2019. March and April will be interesting. With all the over flowing morgues and killer virus cutting down healthy 30 years, we should easily be able to see the bump above baseline of all cause death 2010 to 2019

@tony_burnetti @Lan_Alexander_ @kjoules If an unvaccinated 75 year with 2 comorbidities survives virus and a vaccinated with 1 comorbidity dies of virus, we can not say being vaccinated is saving them and indeed may harm them. We need see death cert. Most are elderly and have 2 to 4 comorbidity.

@kjoules @wanderer_jasnah But are you comparing apples to apples? HK data is being drawn from the past few weeks. The start of an outbreak generally experiences a rapid compounding increase from a zero base from onset vs countries which have been dealing with Covid for two years. How about historically?

@Mendax48989587 @kjoules The average age of a covid death will always be approximately the life expectancy, because your risk of death from covid is proportional to your total risk of death from all causes
@Mendax48989587 @Lan_Alexander_ @kjoules The majority of the elderly in Hong Kong is also unvaccinated, ridiculously enough

@Lan_Alexander_ @kjoules Covid kills 75 to 85yr olds. There are many age 75 to 90 in Hong Kong as a % of the HK population due to long life expectancy and that is why the UK , with a 3.5 year shorter life expectancy than HK, has many less people in the age group covid kills. UK to HK is apples to oranges

@kjoules Covid death average age is 80 to 82. Hong Kong  life expectancy is 85.3 versus uk 81.8. So,there are a lot more old people around 80yr old on per capita basis in HK,than UK, so there are more deaths per capita in HK than in UK. UK to HK is apples to oranges demographically.
@kjoules @JCOviedo6 Sir covid is last month we now have nuclear war
@kjoules Really past the peak? Is your graph of all of us infected by 20 March still in track?

@kjoules Looking at UK excess deaths on OWID, the worst UK week actually probably averaged around 26 COVID deaths per million. The takeaway being, *even accounting for under-counts* at the start of the pandemic, HK’s current (rising) death rate is akin to the UK’s worst unvaccinated week.
